info.title: Dubcast Radio API
info.description:
Dubcast Internet Radio API.
Contains public, user, and admin endpoints.

tags.name: Schedule entries (Admin)
tags.description: CRUD endpoints for managing radio schedule entries. Typically used from admin tools.

tags.name: Chat
tags.description: Public chat history endpoints. Messages are returned in chronological order (oldest first) inside each response.

tags.name: Radio
tags.description: Public endpoints for reading current radio state.

tags.name: Users (Admin)
tags.description: Admin endpoints for managing users: create, read, update, delete and change password.

tags.name: Admin Programming
tags.description: Admin-only endpoints for managing radio schedule and playlists.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Endpoints for user registration, login and JWT token validation.

tags.name: Profile
tags.description: Endpoints for managing the current user's profile.

tags.name: Parser
tags.description: Endpoints for parsing SoundCloud tracks and playlists by URL.

tags.name: Playlists
tags.description: Endpoints for managing radio playlists and importing them from external sources.

tags.name: Tracks (Admin)
tags.description: CRUD endpoints for managing tracks in the system. Intended for admin/back-office usage.

tags.name: Radio Programming (Public)
tags.description: Read-only endpoints to inspect radio schedule around the current time.

get.description: Returns full user information for the given user ID.

put.description:
Updates user's email and role.
Password is not changed here â€“ use the dedicated change password endpoint.

delete.description:
Deletes a user by ID.
This operation is irreversible and should be used with care.

get.description: Returns a single track by its identifier.

put.description:
Updates an existing track by ID.
All updatable fields are taken from the request body.

delete.description:
Deletes an existing track by its ID.
Typically used to clean up invalid or obsolete tracks.

get.description:
Returns a single schedule entry by its identifier.
Only accessible for ADMIN users.

put.description:
Updates an existing schedule entry.
Only accessible for ADMIN users.

delete.description:
Deletes a schedule entry by ID.
Only accessible for ADMIN users.

put.description: Updates the current user's username. Must be unique.
Updates the bio field of the current user.

put.summary: Change track in an existing slot
put.description: Replaces the current track in a schedule slot with another track.

Reorders all slots for a given day according to the provided list of slot IDs.
All IDs must belong to that specific day.

schema.description: List of slot IDs in the desired order

404.description: Day or one of the slots not found

get.description: Returns the full list of users in the system.

post.description:
Creates a new user with a given email, role and password.
This endpoint is intended for admin usage (e.g. back-office user management).

409.description: User with this email already exists

post.description:
Changes password for the specified user.
This is an admin-only operation and does not require the old password.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User ID whose password is changed

get.description:
Returns the full list of tracks in the catalog.
Can be used in admin UI to browse or search tracks.

post.description:
Creates a new track in the catalog.
Typically used from admin tools or import flows.

get.description:
Returns the full list of schedule entries.
Intended for admin tools / back-office operations, not for end users.

post.description:
Creates a new schedule entry (track slot in the radio timeline).
Only accessible for ADMIN users.

Imports a playlist from an external URL (for example, SoundCloud playlist URL),
parses its metadata and stores it as a new playlist in the system.
Accepts a SoundCloud track URL and returns parsed track metadata.

400.description: Invalid URL format or unsupported resource.

500.description: Unexpected server error while contacting SoundCloud or parsing the track.

post.description: Accepts a SoundCloud playlist URL and returns metadata for all tracks in the playlist.

400.description: Invalid URL format or unsupported resource.

500.description: Unexpected server error while contacting SoundCloud or parsing the playlist.

post.description: Accepts a SoundCloud track URL and returns its duration in seconds.

404.description: Track not found or duration could not be determined.

schema.description: Duration of the track in seconds.

400.description: Invalid URL format or unsupported resource.

500.description: Unexpected server error while contacting SoundCloud or parsing metadata.

post.description:
Validates the provided JWT token and returns information about its validity,
expiration time and optionally the user identity.

requestBody.description: Object containing the token to validate

400.description: Validation failed (e.g. token is missing or malformed)

post.description:
Creates a new user account and returns an authentication response
(typically containing a JWT access token and basic user info).

400.description: Validation failed (invalid email, weak password, etc.)

post.description:
Authenticates a user using email and password.
On success returns an AuthResponse with a JWT access token.

400.description: Validation failed (e.g. missing email or password)

post.summary: Append a single track to global schedule
post.description: Appends a single track to the end of the current radio schedule.
Appends all tracks from the specified playlist to the end of the current radio schedule.

post.summary: Insert a track into a day schedule
post.description:
Inserts a track into the schedule of a specific day at a given position.
Position is zero-based (0 â€” at the beginning, 1 â€” after the first slot, etc.).

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Zero-based position in the day schedule

400.description: Invalid parameters (e.g. position out of range)

get.summary: Get schedule entries in a time range
get.description:
Returns all schedule entries that intersect with the given time range.
Time parameters are expected in ISO-8601 format with offset, for example:
2025-12-07T10:00:00+03:00

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start of the time range (inclusive), ISO-8601 with offset

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End of the time range (exclusive), ISO-8601 with offset

get.description:
Returns all schedule entries for a specific calendar day.
Date parameter is expected in ISO format, e.g. 2025-12-07.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Day for which to return schedule, ISO date

get.description:
Returns information about the track that is currently playing on the radio.
If there is no scheduled track at the current time, the API responds with HTTP 204 No Content.

204.description: Nothing is playing right now (no scheduled entry for the current time)

get.description:
Returns the previous schedule entry before the current time.
If there is no previous slot, the API responds with HTTP 204 No Content.

Returns the next schedule entry after the current time.
If there is no upcoming slot, the API responds with HTTP 204 No Content.

Returns the schedule entry (track/slot) that is active at the current time.
If there is no active slot, the API responds with HTTP 204 No Content.

204.description: No current schedule slot (nothing is scheduled right now)

get.description: Returns email, username, bio and other data of the currently authenticated user.
Returns a list of all playlists available in the system.
Returns a single playlist by its identifier.

404.description: Playlist with the given ID was not found.

delete.description: Deletes a playlist by its identifier. This operation is typically available only for admins.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the playlist to delete

404.description: Playlist with the given ID was not found.

get.description:
Returns the last N chat messages as a flat list.

Messages are ordered from oldest to newest inside the response.
This endpoint is typically used on initial page load to show recent chat activity.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of messages to return. If not specified, defaults to 50. Values <= 0 or > 200 are normalized on the server side.

200.description: List of chat messages successfully returned

get.description:
Returns a page of chat messages for infinite scroll / lazy loading.

Messages inside each page are ordered from oldest to newest.
Page index is zero-based (page=0 is the most recent page).

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Zero-based page index. 0 = latest messages page.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Page size (number of messages per page). If not specified, defaults to 50. Values <= 0 or > 200 are normalized on the server side.

200.description: A page of chat messages successfully returned

get.description:
Returns a paginated list of schedule slots for a given date.
This endpoint is intended for the admin panel to view and manage the radio schedule.

delete.description: Deletes a schedule slot by its ID and rebuilds the schedule for that day.

409.description: Slot is currently playing and cannot be deleted

CreateUserRequest.description: User data and password to create
